result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joe Albert Rauch

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant re:  contact info for attorney on this case.  (Joe A. Rauch - #111386, Waupun Correctional Institution, PO Box 351, Waupun WI 53963-0351).

Defendant Joe Albert Rauch not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Joe Albert Rauch.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Joe Albert Rauch not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video, as a friend of the court, for Joe Albert Rauch.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Attorney Plummer is willing to accept case as a PD appointment. Court adjourns matter for a pre-trial conference in Branch 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Nicholas M Weege in court, defendant Joe Albert Rauch not in court, in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Scheduling Conference.  Defense counsel has left his firm and advises Court that case will be transfered to attorney Plummer.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 41.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Court continues cash bail previously set.  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  MCSO did not provide executed warrant at time of scheduling.  Defendant at Waupun Correctional.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with H.A.W.

Defendant Joe Albert Rauch in court with attorney Nicholas M Weege.  Defendant Joe Albert Rauch in custody at Waupun Correctional.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joe Albert Rauch appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's 2ND Letter re:  clearing warrant on this case.  (Joe A. Rauch - #411386, Waupun Correctional Institution, PO Box 351, Waupun WI 53963-0351).
Letter from defendant re:  clearing warrant on this case.  (Joe A. Rauch - #411386, Waupun Correctional Institution, PO Box 351, Waupun WI 53963-0351).
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Nicholas M Weege in court.  Mark Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail.

Attorney Nicholas M Weege in court, defendant Joe Albert Rauch not in court, in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has not received discovery and an offer from the state. Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with H.A.W.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joe Albert Rauch in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Joe Albert Rauch in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
